document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Termioptycha Meyrick, 1889 (Lepidoptera, Pyralidae) from China, with descriptions of four new species

Diagnosis. Adult ( Fig. 12 ) wingspan 24.0–31.0 mm. This species is diagnostic in the male genitalia by the gnathos with an arched median process lacking setae ( Fig. 21 ), and in the female genitalia by the ductus bursae with a large sclerotized basal plate that is widened medially, U shaped posteriorly, inverted triangular anteriorly, and a pair of equally sized signa ( Fig. 27 ).
Termioptycha margarita
is similar to
T. albifurcalis
in the forewing pattern, and the differences between the two species are stated under the proceeding species.

Distribution. China ( Anhui , Beijing , Chongqing , Fujian , Guangdong , Guangxi , Guizhou , Hainan , Hebei , Henan , Hubei , Hunan , Jiangxi , Shaanxi , Shanxi , Sichuan , Taiwan ,
Tianjin
, Yunnan , Zhejiang ); Japan , Korea , Malaysia , Indonesia , India , Sikkim , Bhutan , Russia .
